text: Yep...definitely coming back here.  Kelly our waitress was such a sweet woman. Got our Cheesy Cheesesteak Club card. :-)

My wife and I ordered from here last night and were blown away by the quality and cost!
The owners and staff are AMAZING!!! Sad that they are closed on Sundays but will definitely be ordering from here on a regular basis.
We had the cheesesteak and wings, all of it was delicious.
Went there expecting a great hamburger tasted like a regular Frozen hamburger patty the place is small the service was slow would not recommend it

Used the Entertainment Book to find this gem. It's pretty small and ordinary inside but the food is very good. I ordered the 5-inch cheesesteak and wished I'd gotten the 10-inch. My wife got a cheeseburger with provolone and loved it. Curly fries were good, too. We're just visiting Las Vegas but will definitely be back when we visit again.

Enjoyed our lunch here!!! Burgers were delicious!!! My daughter truly enjoyed here Cheesesteak!!! Saturday's special of ordering a burger you get free fries and a drink! Judy was awesome!!! The salted Carmel Oreo sundae was awesome!!!!

My son introduced me to this little great place. By far the best  Cheese Stake I've had.

To complete your meal have to try the deep fried Oreo. 

Really good eats!!

What a great little find!  Super friendly service, good prices and REALLLLLLLLY good bar food.  Their fried pickles were unlike anything I've ever tried.  They look like shoestring fries, but they're battered and fried dill pickles!  So yummy!  Also loved the deep friend mac n cheese.  Are you seeing a theme here? These people know how do deep fry.

We came for the cheesesteaks, though (thanks to the Yelp recommendations), and they did not disappoint.  Tasty meat, nice fresh soft bread... juicy and cooked just right.

The only thing that keeps me from giving 5 stars is the EXTREMELY smokey bar attached to the restaurant, which you have to walk through to use the restroom.  Any time someone would open the door to go use the restroom, plumes of smoke would waft in and practically gave us black lung.  It was really bad.

But I'll be back!  I'll ask for a table as far away from the bar as we can get next time.... but I'll be back!

Cool little joint in town . Me and my husband go with the kids and never leave unhappy . My 5 year old loves the macaroni and cheese balls with ranch ,tenders and all the French fry options , and the Oreos are delicious . You can Build your own phillys which is a nice option to change it up . Try the pizza philly for sure ! another good thing is the side salads are great size and Italian dressing is also yummy . Best phillys we've had in town .

I like the atmosphere, the decor, and food. It's a feel good place. 

This is the best Philly Cheesesteak in the world. It's something about the bread that makes it a cut above the rest. 

Once I find something delicious, I hardly let go. I haven't tried anything else on the menu for this reason. 

The kitchen closes at 8pm and is closed on Sundays.

Same awesome food as the Decatur oakey location.  Just found them again spread the word loyal las vegans. Let's keep up all of our longtime traditions and support Jim and Judy.  Want to keep them around for another 27 years.

This little hole-in-the-wall is a hidden gem off the strip in Las Vegas.  The owners are SUPER nice and beyond friendly, and just showed us genuine hospitality.  I love the simple, well-made food (small salad for $1.99!?  Yes please!) that is just perfect pub/dive restaurant fare.  We ordered the cheesesteaks (wow, not on the diet but worth it).  You could have a fried oreo if you wanted, but we opted out.  Just really personal, genuine service with good food to match.

I ordered a big philly with everything and ate it next door at Boodles.

The sandwich was fine.  But for $13, I expect a little better than "fine."  I've had better Philly cheesesteak sandwiches elsewhere, and I'm from North Dakota for crying out loud.

Eating the sandwich at Boodles wasn't the greatest idea either.  It's small and appears to have a regular customer base.  I've been treated on a contiuum ranging from indifference to hostility on earlier visits to Boodles.

On a previous visit, I got the stink eye from some wannabe biker guy for about 15 minutes.  Just a heads-up to biker guy...your tough guy facade would be more effective if you were not watching golf on TV.  Jesus.

This is by far the best hamburger you can get in town! The food is perfect, the service very good, and ambiance reminded me of my Grandmothers kitchen. A full bar is attached but separated from the restaurant, bring the whole family, best lemonaide ever! Thank You Triple Play American Grill. I go every week now...............
LOVE this place. Kelly & the rest of the staff are great! We definitely have to come back.

My daughter and I ate here for the very first time and loved the experience, service / food. We told our waitress that we loved the place, will return with friends and family. We like and look for the non-food chain restaurants. That's where you'll find best food and service. Thank you again Triple Play American Grill and see you soon.

Good news, bad news. Good news is that Triple Play is BACK! Bad news is that it's not QUITE the same Triple Play that I remember.

When I learned months ago that the Triple Play on Oakey and Decatur had closed, I was heartbroken. GONE was a great, smoky Vegas bar with beer by the pitcher. GONE was a pretty tasty cheesesteak.  And, worst of all, GONE was the best club sandwich I have ever eaten. 

But then I learned through Yelp that -- like the phoenix -- Triple Play had risen from the ashes and had been rechristened as "Triple Play American Grill." It's taken us some time, but my husband and I stopped by the new location today for lunch. And while the ambiance leaves a little to be desired, it's still the same great food that I love, even if the portions are a little smaller than I remember. (And no pizzas or ostrich burgers, old timers.)

Of course I ordered the club sandwich. And while it tasted as good as ever, it seemed a bit small. (Maybe that's just a false memory, because I still ended up taking home half the sandwich like I used to do.) The steak fries tasted the same, but that portion seemed a bit skimpy, too.

My husband had the patty melt with curly fries. Same great sandwich; same great fries. But, once again, the portion seemed a little smaller than before.

Our waitress was friendly and attentive, but we were the only ones in the small, brightly lit place. How I miss the days of waiting for a booth in the darkened back room on Decatur! But this is now the Triple Play AMERICAN Grill, and you can sure tell by the decor. (All I can say is, USA! USA!)

We didn't order drinks from the adjacent Boodles Tavern, so I'm not sure if they offer beer by the pitcher. And we didn't order a cheesesteak, although that seems to be a popular item, if the menu is any indication. (Lots of different versions are available, and the restaurant's branding proclaims itself Home of "THE CHEESESTEAK.") But our food was great, as expected. I just miss the smoky goodness (and tiny beer glasses) of the original Triple Play. 

I'm sure I'll be back; I just need to move into the future and remember the past with fondness. I'm glad the reincarnated Triple Play exists. But I still miss you, old-school Triple Play. (Sad tear. And ... scene.)
Excellent wings, ribs and burgers. Also fried Oreo dessert was excellent!!!!!!  Would come back weekly!!!!
Just had a fabulous philly steak sandwich here. The chef Jim definitely knows how to make these.

My wife and I have enjoyed this eatery many years at two locations. The cheesesteaks are the best. Actually every item we have tried was outstanding. The service has always been  over the top. This cozy little mom & pop
Restaurant will soon be gone as they will be closing at the end of Dec 2016 due to the strip mall ownership. Please stop in one last time and enjoy a great sandwich.

First, we are visitors from Hawaii and we came here because of great reviews, unfortunately those reviews turned around to be a mediocre experience.


Food was great!
I had Reuben sandwich, my boyfriend had cheesesteak, my boyfriend nephews had a pizza cheesesteak, and Las Vegas).

But the service wasn't great. This place is small and seemed to look like local people comes here frequently. When we entered and during our dine in we didn't have any attention (when we entered, 2 workers, ladies is just staring at us and talking story to the the lady sitting at a table) and from the waitress (older lady but looked young) barely checked on us. What made me irritated a little was a bunch of people were coming and the two ladies working the floor greeted them and provided attention.

These workers should provide equal service to every customer! 

Great food! Bad experience

I finally ventured out from the chicken wing, Philly cheese steak, or French dip norm, and tried something new. The Saturday bbq ribs special is beyond delicious. The ribs fall off the bone. The sauce is flavorful. It comes with coleslaw or potatoe salad and fries. I'm not normally a big coleslaw fan and I'm very picky, but this coleslaw is delish! It also comes with a pineapple delight/ambrosia, which to me is a perfect after meal type of dessert. 

The Saturday burger special is another great deal with a very tasty burger, with your choice of fries (steak, shoestring or curly), and your drink is free. The fries come unsalted, but they come out hot enough for the table salt to stick. 

Kudos to the chef!
Great Philly cheesesteak's, amazing service. You can't go wrong with this place and they do deep fried Oreos.

The place reeks of cigarette smoke. The waitress wasn't personable. She came up to the table and just stood there. Didn't ask us how we were. Didn't smile. Just stood there with the pen at the ready. And this is how she acted throughout the whole meal - which wasn't great. When I saw "best patty melt you'll ever eat" on the menu, I wasn't really expecting it to be. I was expecting it to be decent though. But when I bit into it, I was completely mistaken. It had no flavor at all. I had to add salt to it as I was eating it. The pickle fries were good though. But I probably will not be coming back.

I met up here with a very good friend, Pam. She had informed me that they will be closing their doors for good due to circumstances out of the owner's control. It's heart breaking because everyone here, from the staff right down to the patrons are all so warm and friendly. The food was DELICIOUS!! I would've really liked to have sampled more items from the menu but I couldn't exactly make a pig out of myself and unfortunately my next visit to Vegas won't be until Feb or Mar and by then, they'll be gone  I didn't meet the owners but I wish them the best of luck in their next venture....I'm hoping it's a re-open in a new location!
It maybe small but the food was very good. Service was excellent. The ranch dressing was awesome. Certain days they run specials. Just as good or better than fudd ruckers.

omg hands down the best cheesesteak in Vegas. I eat here at least twice a wk. and for every 9 I buy I get one free (chzstk club). they do have other stuff on the menu thats just as good like the turkey melt or the patty melt, but their chzstks are mostly what I order.  DW.

In a town that is constantly trying to reinvent itself, it's nice that there are still some things you can count on,  like great food and friendly service at Triple Play American Grill.  After the namesake restaurant closed it's doors last December,  several of us long time locals were left with a hankering for some of the favorites we loved for so long.   At the new TPAG the atmosphere is relaxed and everyone is super friendly, but most importantly, our favorite dishes are back!  The tender and delicious cheesesteaks, hearty burgers, stacked sandwiches and even fresh salads for those watching their figures.  Classic American, done right.  

We are so glad Jim has found a new home and can't wait to go back!!

Stopped in for lunch- friendly staff and owner reminded us of all the businesses that have been in this space for the past several years, most recently a hotdog place but way back in '09 had the best damn barbeque ever as Red Apple Barbeque.

In any case, this place now specializes in cheese steaks- so we tried the 5" Moe (grilled onions and mushrooms, my favorite combination) with curly fries and a 6-piece order of the buffalo wings.

Cheese steak was tasty- very literal interpretation of the dish, with plenty of shaved steak and melty cheese sauce woven into the entire sandwich. Onions and mushrooms were perfect, fresh roll it was served on held up without being too hard or too soft.

Wings were also decent- hot here would be considered mild anywhere else, but they were decently sized and had good flavor.

Service was polite, business began to pick up as we left around 4PM.

I had a craving for a cheesesteak, so I went to reliable Yelp for a recommendation. It brought me here. I was not disappointed. The cheesesteak was moist, tender, and delicious! The bread was perfect. I also tried the Mac and cheese bites, and they were great too. Their homemade ranch is excellent!

The "hole in the wall" location makes it even more of a gem, and the service from the two owners was lots of fun. Super nice people. Can't wait to go back.

This is not a great location for this business. That said, they have the best wings ever, really great customer service, the whole customer base seems to be regulars and the food is all around awesome. Don't let the parking lot keep you from visiting this treasure.
Jim and Dina rocked the Cheesesteak salad!  Great food and service!  The philly was great the last time as well!

RIP to the best cheesesteak in town!!! 

Please reopen somewhere else in town!
My only job was to find a big juicy burger, I found it!  They have a good variety from cheesesteak to clam chowder ...I will be returning!

The cook was extremely kind...but the woman who took my payment was rude. She didn't say 1 word to me it even a thank you...she didn't even hand me the bag as I'm standing in front of here she places it in the table so I have to walk to get it! It's a shame cause the food was decent but won't return because I can't overlook the way she treated me-

Wow I remember going to triple play all the time. I was sad to see the Decatur location closed. And now I find them on yelp and see another location has been up and running this is awesome. Can't wait to go.

My parents have been getting these cheese steaks since like 1987. Ive been experiencing the awesomeness since I can remember (born in 1992). I was torn apart when I drove by and saw the old place closed. Ive been checking online periodically to see if there was any news. 

To my surprise tonight I saw the restaurant moved. So of course I called and ordered the same cheese steak Ive been eating since I was 5 years old. It was everything I remembered and more. The mushrooms, peppers, and onions were super flavorful! Curly fries are slightly thicker but otherwise exactly the same. Bun was different as well, it held up better to the massive amount of topping on this sadwhich.  The inside of the restaurant is cleaner and more inviting than the previous location. I love this place so much and will continue to go here as long as the food is around. I will be spreading the word. If you love a great cheese steak come here!

Wow , what a great experience! Nice and cozy inside, and the owners are super nice and friendly. We ordered the "Vegas"  chicken cheesesteak with onion rings and a cheesesteak with onions and fries. Both were absolutely delicious... The chicken and the steak were loaded with flavor, and the bread was nice and soft. Fries and onion rings are super good as well. I highly recommend coming here and trying this place out. Can't wait to come back.

Love the chicken philly cheesesteak - especially with horseradish sauce. Judy's Noodle Doodles are yummy full of butterscotch, crisp chinese noodles and nuts!  Great food and people - thank you Jim  and Judy for opening up your new home!

Great Philly Steaks! I like the beef and my wife likes the chicken-both are great! Love this new location since it is close to my home. Wish they delivered and I would go more often but they are not shy about their prices. I will still be a twice a month customer.

The burger was so-so and the money adds up as you put your toppings on. I've read that their cheesesteaks are the things to get so maybe because their thermostat was on the blink they took less than perfect care of our cheeseburger order, the next time I visit here I'll try the cheesesteak.

Amazing Philly cheesesteaks. Top 5 in town for sure.

This place was recommended by our professor at CSN. My classmates and I decided to come here in between our classes for lunch. You can get a 5 inch for about $7 which is a pretty good deal considering it taste amazing. You can add fries or a drink with it for extra. 

The staff is super nice, nothing negative to say. Even though we came to order out they were still very attentive  to us.

This restaurant is also connected to a bar I never been in it but Philly cheesesteaks and alcohol sound like a good time!

Back again for a second helping of a cheesesteak and wings I was still blown away on how awesome the food and service. All I can say triple play is a Great little local spot hands down the best Philly cheesesteak in Vegas

OMG. Rarely do I use the phrase "Best thing I EVER ate!",  but I used that phrase today at Triple Play. My Mom is friends with Jim and Judy, the owners. So, today we decided to swing in for lunch. Cutest little place with a few stools and a center island, and about 8 booths.

Mom had the crab melt sandwhich,  and shoestring fries. These days Mom doesn't have much appetite,  but she plowed her way through that sandwich like a champ!

I had the fried zucchini,  for starters. Best I have EVER had. Fresh zucchini,  hand battered right there, and deep fried. No frozen crap...amazingly good and crunchy. I could eat that every day. (But I won't :-)

I ordered the fish and chips, and again....best EVER. SO light and crunchy...not the slightest bit greasy. My mother is from England, and she declared them "perfect", and she's right. 

Jim, the owner, used to cook for The Triple Play on Decatur for many years until they closed. That guy can COOK. Then he made us (ha!) try his fried blond oreo's with salted caramel ice cream. Oh. My. God. When I die I don't need any food in heaven :-) except that.

Great diner food prepared exceptionally well. Will definitely be back, sooner rather than later.
The best cheesesteaks in Las Vegas! Great food and even more great staff! The most amazing, nice and awesome service, and did I say the food was amazing!!!!! Will come back guaranteed!

I was CRAVING a turkey sandwich and they have a turkey melt on their menu, so I decided to drop in. The turkey melt with bacon was very good, but only came with cheddar cheese on it. But per the menu, it did say that that it only had these 3 ingredients, so I can't hold it against them! It's a rich sandwich, so next time I'll probably order it with tomato and lettuce.

Wow... This place is a hidden Gem!! Food is fabulous, prices are great and the people are very personable! My family and I found this place thanks to Yelp and boy am I glad. Only 2 miles down the road and worth every penny! Can't wait to go back! The Philly is amazing and do yourself a favor ... order the mac & cheese wedges OMG!!

I'm so excited that I found the original chef from the former Triple Play! Food is wonderful as usual & so is the service! Now for Jim to bring back the French Dip or at the very least the Au Jus! That would make me super happy!

I went here and didn't know what to expect but this is absolutely amazing. I want to come back again and again. The food is so good, especially the sweets. Great and friendly customer service and it's a homey place - plus great prices. Thanks so much for a great evening, I'll be back!

Philly - AMAZING!  Had to take a star away because it reeks like smoke from the attached gaming room. 

Fast friendly service.

This place is AMAZING! I had the philly cheesesteak and the pickle fries! OMG those pickle fries!! The Bf had french dip so soft and tasty!! I stopped a few times to look into my sandwiches eyes wherever they were and ask myself if this was real!? My sandwich replied...Yes and I continued to savor each second. I don't remember the last time I've look at my food and wanted to make out with it. Triple play has done it!!
Ive only had the cheesesteak and it was scrumdidilyumtious!!!!!!

Many what can I say about this place.  Good food, great service, great owner and again great food!!!  My wife and I LOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE coming here for lunch.  Portion size for the money is on spot for starters.  Ive now tried the philly steak which I must say is awesome!!!!  The bread that it is served on is right on point!!!  I have also had the grilled chicken cheese sandwich with grilled onions!!!  Woah!!!!  I had that on the Kaiser bun instead of sourdough and lets say it's the best in Vegas.  Simple and full of flavor.  The chicken is made of breast meat and NOT dry!!!  Sides I have tried have been the steak fries and they rock!!!  Also I order most of the time as my side and that is the coleslaw man oh man!!!  It is made fresh, crispy crunchy cabbage not that bucket stuff but he makes this home made!!!  Served with a pickle wedge with your order.  Another point I must say on sides is i have had the onion rings.  They are a tempura style onion ring and hands down the best in Vegas!!!!  Wife has shared her burger with cheese with me and I must say, that Kaiser bun, 1/2 pound patty grilled to perfection is bursting with flavor!!!  It's a hole in the wall type of dive but the food is bigger than the place!!!  This is a must try!!!!  Dining room is not very big, but the owner just may need to expand if the trend of filling the place continues. We discovered this joint in December 2014 and go twice a week now for lunch.  What are you waiting for stop reading this and get some food!!!
Same good food as the old Decatur location. The Philly Cheese Steaks are bomb. Same awesome serving staff as well.....

This is a lil hole in the wall in a nice location. Clean establishment but not really where you would wanna go to socialize. It would be a tight squeeze. The fare is basic american food, no frills. You wont be dissatisfied but you wont be amazed. Go here if you want a satisfying lunch!

A must place to visit. I have been there many times, sometimes during their slow time and sometimes during their busy times. Always do I get excellent service outstanding food and a very pleasant check. The service is good, the food is good and the prices are good. Go visit. I promise you that you will not regret it.
the cheesesteaks are pricey but they are the best in town,  chicken cheesesteak is great too.  no, they don't compare to Pat's but we're in vegas.

I wish the place were bigger, like the old location.  BUT...

Same fantastic food!  Same fantastic wait staff (LOVE YA KELLY)!  And now the place is kid friendly since it's separate from / adjacent to Boodles Tavern.

My first time at Triple Play American Grill. After seeking the best cheesesteaks in Vegas, I finally found it!  Judy is awesome and takes good care of her customers!  I will definitely be a regular customer!!! Thanks, Jim and Judy!

I had a craving for a French Dip, I haven't had one in many years but for some reason I could not get the thought of one out of my mind for 2 weeks! 

I was looking at places near me with traditional american food.  Surprising to find out very few had a French Dip.  My first hit with one near me was here, so I ordered.

This was THE Best French Dip I have ever had!  Seriously, ever.  I always add cheese, they had a white swiss american sounded good so I went with it.  I also found out not all of the sandwiches or burgers come with fries, mine did!  I got the shoestring fries, yummy.  I brought my sandwich home looking forward to it but wasn't expecting this.  Opened up my box to a nicely packed meal.  One of the things I liked best about the packing is the sandwich was wrapped in paper so it wouldn't get all mushy form the steam from the fries my pickle was also wrapped to keep it crisp as well.  I opened my package of sandwich I have been thinking about for 2 weeks to a burst of the smell of roast beef.  Open my Au Jus to a nice clean broth the prettiest broth I have ever seen, it did not have a sticky layer of grease just beautiful aromatic broth.  

The sandwich was good it had a good amount of meat to bread ratio and then the angels sang into my ears as I dipped my sandwich into that amazing looking broth and tasted possibly the best Au Jus I have ever had in my life.  I grew up in the midwest and French Dips are a big thing out there so I have had more then a few french dips in my lifetime.  This broth was so rich and flavorful I closed my eyes and dreamed for a moment.  This sandwich was so good I have been back a second time in a 1 1/2 weeks time.  This Au Jus is a serious  thing, like Pho and Ramen if you mess up the base there is no coming back.  This Au Jus will make me become a regular, I am looking forward to trying other things but right now it's all about the Au Jus...

When I am ready I am looking forward to trying the Ruben next.

The Five Stars are for this sandwich and togo service.  The waitress on the phone was very nice and suggested this particular cheese.  When I came in to get my grub the cooks was an older man supper friendly and nice.  The restaurant part was like an old school dinner and had quite a few people in it eating a bit older but who cares.  Seemed very clean and you don't have the smoke from the bar attached to it because of the glass wall.

Great service, great food as always and we are just so happy they found a new bar to reopen Triple Play. We just took a friend there from Kentucky and he enjoyed it just as much as we do. You guys rock the best bar food!

I went here in 2015. It was in a shopping center, Pretty much a sketchy looking place. I was drawn here by yelp reviews. All reviewers were right, I had a cheesesteak which was bomb and fries. The people who worked here were all pretty nice. They told me that the place had been sold and they basically had to find other jobs which was bad. It did need a remodel but it wasn't a bad place.

By far the most amazing Veggie Wrap I have ever had! It tastes just like a Philly Cheesesteak but healthier!!!!! Husband ordered the salad and loved it. My son loves coming here and building his own sandwich.

I'm so happy they found a new location. The Philly Cheese-Steak is by far the best. The bread they get is amazing! It soaks up the juice without falling apart. The burgers are also great, made to order with whatever your little heart desires, and as always, the people are friendly and take good care of you.
Thank you for the AYCE breakfast during the SEC football season. Jim cooks amazing grits even though he is a Yankee! Of course the Cheese Steaks are the bomb!!!

The staff was really nice, but the food was mixed.

My friend and I went here one night, because I had a half off coupon. When we walked in, we noticed the place was a bit smaller than we expected. It was quite intimate and quiet. I was sort of uncomfortable, because the other guest didn't smile at us or anything. They just stared and looked out the corner of their eyes.

The waitress saved us. She gave us a welcoming greeting, but then she swiftly walked away to check on her table, and we felt just ass awkward as before. I was confused on whether we were suppose to seat yourselves or wait for her to come back.

It took her a couple minutes to walk back over, so we went to the front and sat down. The waitress then came over and I asked if it was ok that we sit were we had sat. She told us it was fine and then passed us some menus.

The waitress was really nice and motherly. I felt like she wanted to TAKE CARE of us. I wish she had put the order in correctly and then she would have really taken care of us.

The waitress was confused on the coupon we had. It took her a few minutes and she even had to confirm with the man that was cooking the food. She mistakenly told us that we had to eat at the restaurant verses us just carrying the food out. The man/cook (possibly the owner) told her that there was no stipulation to where we ate. (It wasn't a big deal anyways, but she made it slightly a big deal)

So we ordered a 10" cheese-steak with bacon Combo, with steak fries. It took a few minutes to get the food, but once we did, we paid and left.

In the car, where we usually eat, we figured out that we actually had curly fries verses that steak fries we originally ordered. It wasn't a really big deal because I like curly fries too. But, I was a little disappointed that my peppers were not on it.

The sandwich was pretty good. I like the bacon addition. I have never thought to add bacon and I wouldn't have ever tried it, if the waitress didn't tell me that a lot of people get it that way. Either way, I'm glad that I did, because that's what sat the sandwich aside from the rest.

I liked the curly fries but they tasted like any other restaurant. I would compare them to Arby's. They were nothing special.

Also, I ate the sandwich without mayo, I didn't notice until the end. It was that good, I didn't notice that it was plain.

In all, I would go back if they promise to give me what I ask for.

The legendary Las Vegas Philly Cheesesteak is back! This is the same Triple Play that used to be at the corner of Oakey and Decatur, until the buildings owners decided to worship at the godless altar of capitalism, and sold out to put in a garbage slot machine parlor! Just what local Vegas needs: more Jackpot Joanie's & Dotty's... But I digress!

I was in Philly this last winter, and ate the top local rated sandwich in town. That cheesesteak was great, and to be honest, I can't tell the difference from the downtown Philly sandwich to the Triple Play sandwich. Thin sliced steak, provolone cheese, onions and peppers. They have a fairly wide array of other food you'd expect in a bar. And of course there is a glass barrier that splits the restaurant from the bar, so smokers next door aren't an issue. 

I spread the word to a few co-workers that Triple Play is back, and all of them were super excited to be able to grab lunch here again! Bottom line, this is the Las Vegas Philly cheesesteak to have. Enjoy!

I simply adore Kelly and all the great cooks at this spot.  Used to be in the Triple Play Casino and relocated nearby.  GREAT chicken fingers and steak fries, ranch is the bomb diggity and I can bring my kids to there now!
Chicken sub, cheesesteak, Fingers. Great place for a good price. Hours just suck and I miss old location

SO Glad I found these guys again! In case you somehow don't yet know, after the original Triple Play closed, the cook set-up shop here, adjacent/adjoined to Boodles. The place is pretty cozy, but it's clean and comfortable....and it's the only place to get your hands on an original Triple Play cheesesteak. It's every bit as perfect as it used to be, too. I was near devastated when, after only a handful of visits, the old place cut-off my cheesesteak connection by closing down...and I know I'm not alone. Well, dry your eyes, Las Vegas, they're back! So stop in, help re-support a Vegas institution  and take advantage of the glorious rebirth of the undisputed best Philly Cheesesteak in NV. You'll be glad you did, especially when you see how genuinely happy they seem to have you come in. And yeah, while I don't think it's the entire oldschool menu, it's all of the classics and favorites....done exactly right. Booyah!
This place is amazing the food the service were all tremendously wonderful,thank you.

My mom and I came here after reading about it in the Las Vegas Review Journal. Their food is amazing. When I want me some good ol fashioned comfort food, I come here. Their burgers are nice and juicy, and the flavors just blend really well together. One of my favorite things they have are their bottle cap jalapeños. They give you a side of Chipotle ranch, which is the most amazing thing I've ever had in my life. I can't get enough of it! That ranch is so good I even put it on my burger. The nice thing about this place is that they pretty much mix and match anything you see on the menu. The staff is extremely warm and inviting, and I've never had a bad experience there. They're a lovely group of people who make some amazing comfort food. If you leave there hungry, it's your own fault!

Perhaps the best cheese steak in the city...this place used to be located across from Fantastic Indoor Swap Meet formerly Fantastic Furniture Warehouse on Decatur, west of Oakey. So sad when it closed down only to find that the cook Jim Egloff now Owner of the re-emerged Triple Play American Grill next to Boogles right at Antelope and Charleston across from the Hush Puppy. Same wonderful Philly, same wonderful morning potatoes, same everything....enjoy.

I have to change my rating because I was very unhappy with my order this time. Food was still good for my husband and son but they both got burgers. I ordered a cheesesteak with easy peppers, mushrooms and extra cheese I asked that they cook the fries extra crispy so that they are not soggy when I get home. My sandwich was dripping in grease and my bread was falling apart and my fries were under cooked forget about my request.
I do have to say that I did not see Jim so I am not sure if someone else prepared.
I will give it awhile before we try it again.
I got banned from this bar once! Waitress did not like the cut of my jib, so to speak.

I look forward to coming here. The service is extraordinary. I feel like coming here is just like going to your family for dinner but without any of the family drama. We are not the only regulars and they treat everyone with VIP service. I cannot wait to bring my dad here and show him the best Philly Cheese Steak of his life!  i don't know how they do it but they manage to keep the food prices very low. I will keep coming here every week! If I could taste them higher than 5 stars I would.

This place makes me so happy--has a small-town feel with quality food. Excellent burger and steak fries every time we visit, and the customer service is just right. Forget the fancy places, and come enjoy this place! Not too many of you, though--I don't want it too crowded. ;)

Tiny little place located next to Boodles bar, on the corner of Tenaya and Charleston just behind the Frijoles restaurant. Maybe room for 30 inside the restaurant area, or you can eat inside the bar where there is smoking.

Owners were really friendly. This guy has been cooking for Triple Play for a long time. I had the Philly Cheesesteak, my friend went with the build your own burger. Both were really good. I could have used a little more meat in my sandwich. 

Solid food, nothing fancy. Good prices. Nice people make it stand out and worth visiting.

Not a bad burger. Friendly, quick service. The shoe string fries could use more salt but overall a good meal.

An added bonus -- Saturdays are build your own burger with the fries and drink free!

Jim is still cooking up a mean cheesesteak. Ruben was great too with a generous helping of cornbeef. Great to find them and have great food from good people who care about what they serve. I haven't tried everything on the menu " yet" but I will. Nice little place with big flavor food. A little of everything for everyone in your party.

I took my son here for his birthday lunch. We loved it!!! We got the triple play philly cheese steaks OMG  so yummy!!! and the onion rings are to die for!!. Because it was his birthday they served him an ON THE HOUSE desert that truly was one of the best things we've ever had!!! Deep fried golden oreo cookies served with salted Carmel ice cream, Carmel sauce, whipped cream and a cherry. The service was awesome too. You will not be disappointed!!!

First time visiting and very pleased with the food and service! The triple play cheese steak had great flavor and tender beef. Perfect combination of grilled onions, mushrooms, green peppers and cheese. We shared the dessert of fried oreos and salted carmel ice cream in a sundae. OMG, super yummy! This is our new favorite local place to eat! Thanks Judy and Jim!
